ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This main insight this course gave me was the ability to stop overthinking my drawing and searching for the "correct" outcome. This course really made me challenge myself to be ok with creating something I wasn't immediately happy with, knowing that the process would help me improve in the future.
Developed drawing skills, learned about how to represent the figure.
Understanding of human anatomy, various mediums and styles, understanding of figure drawing in a larger artistic tradition
Became a better artist
I learned to better draw the human figure.

I have significantly improved how I approach drawing figures in comparison to how I started this semester thanks to the wide variety of styles approaching figure drawings as well as the unconventional methods to understand the human body.
Learned how to view the figure in the context of its surroundings, some basic drawing and inking techniques.
I learned how to accurately gauge the proportions of the human body to draw a figure.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was really fun and engaging. I feel like I learned a lot. I liked that we used a lot of different mediums and had a wide range of tasks. I might have liked to receive more feedback from the professor/TA.
The course could use perhaps a little more formal instruction, but overall was a great class and gave a lot of chances to draw from live models with
repetative but fun

It was pretty chill, and we had lots of practice. The middle of the semester was a bit tough though because we didn't have any models for a while. I enjoyed it, but I wish I could have figured out how to improve more.
I really enjoyed this course and the freedom of students to work with different mediums and styles. I hope to receive even more critiques on my drawings during the drawing process.
Drawing from models was always a plus, especially in the wide variety of materials that were available.

The strength of this course lies in the in-class practice we had every class. There was never a class in which we were not working on a figure, with the exception of the final, two classes. This model allowed me to practice capturing the essence of the human body in my art given incredibly small time constraints. I would not say there is a significant weakness to this course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would wholeheartedly recommend this course. Since Basic Drawing is a pre-requisite, this class is definitely not for everyone, but it was much less intimidating than I expected during the first week because the students in the class brought a mixture of styles and art backgrounds.
Definitely. You will enjoy it, learn a lot, and the workload is low (almost no assignments outside of class).
Yes  if you want to learn or improve your figure drawing abilities this is a great place to do it
Yes it was interesting
I would recommend it if you're interesting in drawing people and you're okay with seeing naked people.
Yes, it has been one of my favorite classes I have taken at Yale and have helped me improve drastically in understanding values, forms, and the various techniques of utilizing different mediums.

Definitely take this class if you are interested in drawing the figure, or if you want to see your drawing and art in a different way. This course challenges techniques that you've already developed, to push you to leave your comfort zone and explore how to represent the human form in your work.

I would recommend this course to students who are interested in drawing figures. The course has implications for students who might be interested in character design or animation, as I often had to draw the same figure in different positions.
Yes! Amazing, youre given a lot of freedom to determine your subjectivity and how you want to tackle the projects. Also, the TA for the class, Phoebe, was amazing!
